Given right triangle $ABC$ with legs $BC=3$, $AC=4$. Find the length of the shorter \textit{angle trisector} from $C$ to the hypotenuse:\\
\\
$ \textbf{(A)}\ \frac{32\sqrt{3}-24}{13}\qquad\textbf{(B)}\ \frac{12\sqrt{3}-9}{13}\qquad\textbf{(C)}\ 6\sqrt{3}-8\qquad\textbf{(D)}\ \frac{5\sqrt{10}}{6} \qquad$\\
\\
$\textbf{(E)}\ \frac{25}{12}$
